title: Russian Gets Life Sentence for What Court Says Was Moscow-Ordered Murder in Berlin
sub_head: Conviction of Vadim Krasikov adds to mounting tensions between Russia and West
body:
BERLINâ€”A German court on Wednesday sentenced a Russian man to life in prison for shooting dead a former Chechen rebel leader in Berlin at the behest of Moscow, in a case that has further frayed already tense relations between Germany and Russia.
The Berlin court found Vadim Krasikov guilty of gunning down Georgian national Zelimkhan Khangoshvili in a park in broad daylight in August 2019. The court said that the killing was ordered by Russian authorities.
